Summary (from OCLC): Friends Forever contains four tales of friendship and fun! A strange flu descends over Ponyville and Spike and Zecora must work together to find a cure. Princess Celestia enlists Pinkie Pie's help in making a cake for Luna's birthday. Applejack and Fluttershy go camping. And, Rarity travels to Griffinstone to make the perfect uniforms for Gilda the Griffin's new sports team.

Summary (from SkyRiver): The last IDW Spike stories come to a shattering conclusion as Spike faces a crazed killer, the full power of Wolfram & Hart, and the consequences of having a soul and a demonic ex. But it's the appearance of Willow that really shakes things up, not to mention a spaceship and some unexpected old "friends".

218.heading: Spills.
218.title: "From Now On, Leave the Housework to Me!"
218.author: by Bill Kavanagh & Hal Camp.
notes: Summary: Maggie quotes "women's lib" to get Jiggs to vacuum the living room, but he moves her chair and she takes a spill.

219.heading: Spills.
219.title: "I Didn't Hear a Thing, I Was Sound Asleep!"
219.author: Vern Greene
219.appears_in: reprinted (p. 62) in The National Cartoonists Society Album 1965 ed. (New York : NCS, 1965).
notes: Summary: Jiggs puts off fixing the rug, and Maggie takes a spill.

220.heading: Spills.
220.title: "It's Okay, Mommy. Here Comes the Vacuum Cleaner"
220.author: Bil Keane.
notes: Summary: There's a spill in the kitchen, but Barfy's on the job.

221.heading: Spills.
221.title: "Mustard Mixes Up the Muse"
221.author: [No author]
221.series: Our Boarding House with Major Hoople, Dec. 22, 1956
notes: Summary: Alvin's violin lesson with Prof. Frantz isn't going well, because Uncle Amos spilled mustard on the music.

222.heading: Spills.
222.title: "Nonsense! A Round of Golf Will Do You Good! I'll Sit Right Here and Wait While You Zip Through the Housework!"
222.author: by Galbraith ; Gill Fox.
notes: Summary: A husband addresses a wife surrounded by active children, dirty dishes and spills.

223.heading: Spills.
223.title: "Water Dish Spill"
223.author: by Pat Brady & Don Wimmer.
notes: Summary: Peekaboo declines the invitation to assist in Rose's investigation.

224.heading: "Spilly Willy" p. 70-71 in Children's Digest, no. 11 (Oct.
224.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Willy and the new pup both spill things and stand in the corner.

225.heading: Spilly Willy.
225.title: "Standing in the Corner"
225.author: [No author]
225.series: Spilly Willy) 2 p. in Calling All Kids, no. 1
notes: Silent strip.

226.heading: Spilt Ink.
226.title: Dream Life : a Late Coming of Age
226.author: Salgood Sam.

227.heading: Spilt Milk.
227.title: "Except When It's Chocolate"
227.author: Susie MacNelly, Cassatt & Brookins.
notes: Summary: Cosmo has regrets, but doesn't cry over spilt milk.

228.title: Spime.
228.author: [No author]
notes: Description based on Issue #1 (2000 reprint).
Cover title: Space and Time.
By S. Baumann.

229.title: Spike
notes: Common masculine forename or dog's name. See also Sugar and Spike.
